Key Arguments: The legislation undermines democracy by suppressing freedom of speech and expression.
The state has previously abused its powers during the COVID era by collaborating with social media platforms to remove dissenting posts.
The legislation exempts the state from consequences of misinformation or disinformation.
Dissenting views on major topics like climate change, gender issues, immigration, and the Voice are unfairly labeled as misinformation or hate speech.
The legislation will lead to biased media platforms suppressing dissenting voices due to fear of fines.
The legislation is seen as a tool for the government to extend its reach and suppress public opinion.
Notable Quotes: The proposed legislation will prove undemocratic, and a destruction of freedoms and values that Australia boasts of.
ACMA will hold media platforms to account, with the threat of punitively large fines.
Public opinion will be suppressed to the extent that it does not conform to government policy.
